message.content:
cs.CR, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.SI. 

The paper discusses the use of Recurrent Neural Networks (RNNs) for enhancing the effectiveness of signature-based Network Intrusion Detection Systems (NIDS) against zero-day attacks. This topic falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI), as the paper proposes the use of machine learning techniques to improve the performance of NIDS. The use of RNNs also suggests that the paper may fall under the categories of machine learning (cs.LG) and neural networks (cs.NE). Finally, the paper discusses the generation of synthetic traffic to evaluate the effectiveness of NIDS, which may fall under the category of signal processing (cs.SI).
